tags: Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review:
There are no adequate words to express my heartfelt appreciation for Dr. Sanchayan Roy. He brought back my mother from a near-vegetative state to her usual buoyant self. During a span of three years, my 80-year-old mother fractured both sides of her hip; had an infected gallbladder that had to be removed; was diagnosed with Parkinson‚Äôs; suffered from dementia, and silently slid into deep depression. She stopped talking and eating, became immobilized and was unable to control her bodily fluids. Dr. Roy steered back her cognitive skills and with his team rebuilt her broken physical strength. Today she is walking, attending philosophy classes and taking an active interest in life. Dr. Sanchayan Roy returned my mother back to us!

Additionally, Dr. Roy is an excellent geriatric care doctor who combines short-term health problems with long-term continuum of care. He coordinated my mother‚Äôs myriad medications for multiple age-related ailments to create a comprehensive health picture. Based on this he generated a preventive care regime that he enforces by reminding family members to act on it. His continuous care gives us hope that we might be able to mitigate some of my mother‚Äôs anticipated health issues by replacing it with a better quality of life. Dr. Roy truly takes his Hippocratic oath seriously (a rare quality these days).

Having experienced healthcare in many parts of the world, I can say without hesitation that our experience with Dr. Roy ranks among the best, and I have no hesitation whatsoever in recommending him to my friends and to their aging parents. I can cite my experience with Dr. Sanchayan Roy and his team of doctor‚Äôs as a blessing!
reply_text: Thanks for your wonderful feedback. It is very encouraging as a physician when you get such excellent outcomes.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review: For the past two years I have been looking after a lady well into her eighties who lives all by her self. Her family members live in different cities far away and I have been given the responsibility to look after the day-to-day needs of this very frail lady with multiple age-related ailments. Many a time I have had to take quick action when she has suddenly collapsed or fallen without warning. My first response is to call Dr. Sanchayan Roy even before informing her family members. He has always picked up the phone and guided me as to what I need to do to stabilize her. He then either sends an ambulance or arrives himself at his earliest convenience, depending on the severity of the situation. He takes full responsibility of the actions needed. Courtesy Dr. Sanchayan Roy‚Äôs consistent involvement in the health and wellbeing of my employer I am able to fulfill my duties with care and confidence. I have to admit, without Dr. Roy‚Äôs medical support, I might not have accepted this challenging assignment. To me he is the ‚ÄúMiracle Man‚Äù!
reply_text: Thanks Ruby for your encouraging words.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review: My experience with Dr.Roy has been so touching at every step.From the first consultation to his diagnosis about me having a heart attack but not letting me and my wife panic *** ********* ** ******* *** ***** ********** *** *** ****** ** ***** ** ** *** ** *** **** ****** *** has a humanitarian side....He was there enquiring about my well being while i was going through angioplasty at Escorts...his medication was unchanged even by senior cardiologist at Escorts...I and my family will highly recommend him .
reply_text: Thanks very much for your feedback.

tags: None
review: We visited the doctor while experiencing fever and indigestion. However, the sheer amount of medicines that was prescribed was overwhelming considering the symptoms. We were recommended 10 separate medicines with consumption of 2/3 times a day each! Further, he had clearly recommended bery expensive alternatives to generic consumables like probiotic. Would not recommend at all.
reply_text: Hi, I understand that you had fever and indigestion. But that's symptoms. That's not a diagnosis. Treatment is based on diagnosis not on symptoms alone. It is not like 1 tablet per symptom. So counting number of tablets doesn't help if you don't understand why they are being prescribed. So before coming to a social media had you asked relevant questions and doubts about the medication and diagnosis it would have been better. The brands of medicine recommended were generic brands too but there is no compulsion to buy that brand only. You can choose alternative brands. Again you could have asked for alternative brands if required. It would be better in future if you clarify these things with your treating doctor.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review: Dr Roy is a remarkable practitioner.  He heals his patients first with his empathy and sensitivity towards them. This i find is an essential attribute in any doctor who is empowered to heal but one seldom finds a doctor who is first a warm human being and then a doctor. When you visit him he has a sense of assurance that all will be ok.  DR Roy listens patiently and gives time to his patients. He is kind and devises ways for the patient to unferstand the problem he is going through* ** *** ******* ********* *** ****** *** *** ********* ** ******* *** ********* I think Dr Roy is a rare find and a brilliant doctor.  One we should trea sure and learn from. I have greatly benefited from his diagnosis and prognosis and have felt better when I didn't visiting top surgeons even.
reply_text: Thanks for your feedback.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Wait time,Value for money,
review: Initially I thought the doctor is really good, considering his profile on Practo. I had an appointment at 5, reached at the same time. THE SHUTTER OF HIS CLINIC WAS CLOSED. I had a patient with me, who was so dehydrated that he could barely walk. It was such a difficult task to take him out of the house to see a doctor in the first place. When I called the doctor, he just said ‚ÄúHE IS BUSY WITH A PATIENT‚Äù and hung up. I mean, it lies in human courtesy to inform if you aren‚Äôt available at a particular time. * ***** **** **** ** ***** ******* **** ********** ******* ** ****** * **********
reply_text:
Hi Sabia,
I am extremely sorry for the inconvenience caused to you. I regret for the problem  but as a doctor sometimes there are emergencies which are not planned. One patient had come to the ICU at that time and I had to rush there. When I spoke to you I told you clearly regarding the emergency and requested you to reschedule it at 5.45 pm. You said yes and I thought it was fine. My assistant had also tried to call you in the afternoon to reschedule the appointment but could not get through to you. I understand the diffulties faced but sometimes I need to prioritise my patients in a given situation. I still regret the inconvenience caused.

tags: Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review:
I visited him for my back ache, at first he asked me to go for all ******** blood tests ****** *********** ** *** ***** and a MRI (LS spine)for which he asked me to go to his refereed MRI diagnostic centre only which was charging an exorbitant amount, way higher than the other reputed MRI diagnostic centres in South Delhi.
Next thing to be noted here is that when I visited Dr. Ray‚Äôs clinic I was told that if I visit him within five days of the first consultation I would be charged nothing however to my utter disappointment when I duly visited him on the fifth day itself they again charged me with 700 consultation fee which was supposed to be free.In the end, I would not recommend this doctor to anyone for any treatment.. Highly unprofessional and dissatisfied...
reply_text:
Hi, I am surprised and dissapointed by your allegations. The causes of backache are several and so to eliminate systemic problems certain tests are required. Regarding diagnostic centre it was a suggestion only as it was nearby but cost is completely dependent on the diagnostic centre. Also if you felt it was expensive there was no compulsion to get test done from the place. You are always free to choose any diagnostic centre of your own choice.
          As far consultation fees it is a structured thing that is followed for every patient. Your first consultation was on 1st August and next on 6th August. I charge consultation fees again on the fifth day. If you had any problem with it you should have enquired or told me at that time. We could have easily settled the issue. Still if there was any error in calculating the days from my staff, I am sorry but otherwise it is a norm for every patient. 
           I am sorry that you had a bad experience but we wish that you had expressed your concern at that time so that any misunderstanding could have been easily resolved.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
context: Consultation,Sugar Level Check,Fasting blood sugar,Preventive Medicine,Cholestrol Diseases,
review:
I had a mild chest pain and was wondering if it‚Äôs gas or   . Visited Doctor on evening in CR Park clinic . He gave a very patient listening , probed me with medical history , family medical history , and also found that BP was on the higher side . Also gave me immediate medications for gas relief ***** ****** * Some tests had to be done next morning . I can say I was very worried before I met the doctor . After test results were out , most major risks were ruled out , and the areas of attention was taken care if by doctor who gave couple of further medications plus advised a normal diet modification . 
**** **** ****** * And I really will recommend.
reply_text: Thanks Mr. Abhishek for your encouraging words.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Value for money,Treatment satisfaction,Explanation of the health issue,
review: **** ****** ** ************* *** *******. He listens to his patient with patience. Gifts you personal experience in best possible professionalism. The doctor was never in a rush. I interrupted a couple of times however, there's no change in his professionalism. I visited Dr. Roy for mind behaviour reason. His recommended plan of action is doable and helpful.  Three types of medicines were prescribed. Two of which were easily available. The third is still on the way. There's one shortcoming. Dr. Roy arrived 9 minutes late from the scheduled time of appointment. But that can easily be regarded regarding how regardless Delhi's city traffic is.
reply_text: Thanks Sandip for your wonderful feedback. I try my best to be in time but lot of factors make it difficult at times. Anyway will keep it in mind.

tags: None
review: Dr.Roy was both attentive and patient.He took note of my allergy to antibiotics.I did not take the antiviral tablets he prescribed but opted for the two other antibiotics he prescribed.I was a little surprised that he did not request for a feedback.It would definitely lead  to building up trust between the physician and a Senior Citizen.
reply_text: Thank you for your feedback. We believe that if you are satisfied you will automatically give feedback. It is encouraging to get your support as it provides us the zeal and enthusiasm to deal with our patients.

tags: Value for money,
review: I had heard a lot about Dr. Roy but i was disappointed to meet him. Even though the covid cases at that time were only 50-60 he refused to do a physical check up and was seated almost 10 ft apart with a plastic sheet between himself and the patient's chair. * **** ** ** *** ** ****** ** *********** ****** ** ****** **** ******* ** ****** ******** He asked me for get  tests done ***** * ***** *** **** ******* *********** **** * ********* ******* *******I dont recommend him at all
reply_text: Hi, sorry to know that you were disappointed. But more amused to know that after 2 years of pandemic the essence of prevention hasn't yet dawned upon us. Clinic is a place where symptomatic, infected and non infected cases come. The physical barrier is to screen and  understand the problems before examining to be able to segregate the infected from non infected patients. Covid appropriate behaviour shouldn't be tagged as 'scared', it shows lack of awareness. Anyway I don't remember the details of tests but I guess it is a matter of opinion regarding what is necessary and what isn't. Anyway I am sorry if you  found it unnecessary but I recommend what is generally necessary.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Treatment satisfaction,Explanation of the health issue,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
First and foremost would like to thank the Doctor for his patience as I kept on asking lot of questions uninterrupted. Dr Roy is quite humble. The best part is he is very professional. Half of your problems would be solved when you receive those positive vibes from the Doctor. I recommend Dr Roy to all suffering from various ailments. *** ********* ** ****** Thank You Mr Roy for your valuable time. Do appreciate it. 
Regards Ishani

tags: Wait time,
review:
**** ***** *** *** ** * **** ******* The treatment more or less was fine. I‚Äôve seen him at multiple clinics , and every single time (this is the 5th time) , the appointment has to be rescheduled or there‚Äôs an immense wait. I understand, doctors are busy, you have patients to attend to - but when it happens 5 times in a row that you‚Äôre rescheduling  (in advance) then there‚Äôs clearly an issue. 

In addition to that, there are multiple minor issues that have added up. Because of a misspelt name and incorrect date on a prescription (by the doctor) I had to argue at the pharmacy for more than 30 minutes to get medications.

Again, no real problems with Dr. Roy. But if you‚Äôre a busy person, or you have scheduling problems , I can‚Äôt recommend him.  You almost certainly will not get to actually get your appointment on time.
reply_text:
Hi, sad to know about your inconvenience. I apologise for any issue from our side. But having said that these are minor issues which could be resolved by direct communication. Rescheduling of timings is necessary often in this pandemic times due to changed hospital scenarios. If a critical patient has a problem then my priority is first with them ( in the hospital). We have informed you in advance so as to prevent any inconveniences. 
        But nevertheless we will try to look into these issues and solve them as best as possible.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review: Sir is not a diabatician however he saved my life.My report was 416 fasting and after food 636which was a very big reason to worry for me. I have seen my parents crying as I was also diagnosed with fatty liver level 2 as well.Dr Sanchayan Sir saved my life by his guidance and regular follow ups by us at his clinic.I can say that in a month time not only me but also my family has seen a drastic change in my health.I would like to thank Sir for his guidance and help and also will followup till I resume normal life.
reply_text: Thanks for your encouraging words. Wish you a very healthy and happy life.

tags: Treatment satisfaction,
context: Diabetes Treatment,managing acute medical conditions,Consultation,kidney and gall bladder stones,Pre and Post operative conditions,
review:
For an 81-year-old widow with both daughters away, I have often felt alone when sick, which is pretty often. But Dr. Sanchayan Roy made sure I didn‚Äôt feel vulnerable. He held my hand and carefully guided me through the maze of my multiple age-related ailments. 

For more than six years he has successfully treated my short-term problems that keep cropping up now and then, while continuing to manage my long-term chronic problems with unbelievable care and compassion. He listens attentively to what I have to say and answers my random questions patiently. His attention to ensure my well-being is exceptional. Due to the excellent care I have received, my every medical nightmare has changed into a promising dream. 

Though both sides of my hip are broken and I have eight broken ribs, Dr. Roy has made me feel physically, mentally and emotionally strong‚Ä¶ so strong that now I want to live to see my great-grandchildren get married!
reply_text: Thanks for your wonderful feedback

tags: Treatment satisfaction,
review: i visit for my wife angle pain. I am not satisfied with the doctor n number of test suggested. For an angle pain I did not get the idea of CBC and other test. When doctor said himself that there is no hairline fracture or any sort of thing then y go for x-ray. ******** ****** ** **** ******* *** ***** **** ** *** ******* ** *** **** **** Highly disappointed as I read good reviews on practo.
reply_text: Hi, sorry that you were disappointed. As far as diagnosis is concerned the tests help to either confirm or rule out a presumptive diagnosis. CBC is an indicator of infection and inflammation (swelling) in a part of the body. Also X-ray is confirmatory of a fracture. So the tests advised are generally to confirm a diagnosis. I am sorry if you did not get a sufficient clarity on the investigations.

tags: Wait time,Value for money,Treatment satisfaction,
review: Wait time was over 45 minutes, no diagnoses was provided rather further tests prescribed and also test centre suggested.
reply_text: Hi, sorry about the waiting time but sometimes time given gets exceeded while seeing some patients who may have multiple problems. Diagnosis is of paramount importance but a proper diagnosis requires appropriate investigations. So differential diagnosis is what is offered generally till confirmed diagnosis available. Test centre is provided only for convenience but is not mandatory or compulsory. I am sorry if you have any wrong impression about all these facts.
